CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 2, 1957, pg. 1, reads: "Needs Blood Donors - Little three-year-old Clayce Clinton of 529 N. Murtland Ave., Homewood, lies gravely ill in West Penn Hospital and is in need of blood donors. She is a victim of that dread-enemy of modern-day medicine - Leukemia of the blood. Her mother, Mrs. R. J. Clinton, is a daily visitor at the bedside of her daughter, who is fighting so courageously for her life. Call the blood band at the hospital if you wish to donate blood. - Harris Photo."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 23, 1957, pg. 2, reads: "Leukemia Victim Dies - Three-year-old Clayce Clinton of 529 N. Murtland Ave., Homewood, was buried Wednesday after becoming a victim of leukemia of the blood. She is pictured here with her mother, Mrs. Richard J. Clinton, at West Penn Hospital when an appeal was made for blood donors in an attempt to save her life. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Clayce Clinton in hospital bed with her mother Mrs. Richard J. Clinton fixing her hair, and dolls on headboard in background, in West Penn Hospital
